text: Chagallu railway station (station code:CU), is an Indian railway station near Chagallu, a village in West Godavari district of Andhra Pradesh. It lies on the Vijayawada-Chennai section and is administered under Vijayawada railway division of South Coast Railway zone. Eighteen trains halt in this station every day. It is the 2607th-busiest station in the country. ==History== Between 1893 and 1896, of the East Coast State Railway, between Vijayawada and Cuttack was opened for traffic. The southern part of the West Coast State Railway (from Waltair to Vijayawada) was taken over by Madras Railway in 1901. == Classification == In terms of earnings and outward passengers handled, Chagallu is categorized as a Non-Subruban Grade-6 (NSG-6) railway station. Based on the re–categorization of Indian Railway stations for the period of 2017–18 and 2022–23, an NSG–6 category station earns nearly crore and handles close to passengers. == References == == External links == * Category:Railway stations in West Godavari district Category:Vijayawada railway division
title: Chagallu railway station
